answers.q: how much sodium sesquicarbonate added to laundry sop
answers.a: As a laundry booster, use about 1–2 tablespoons (15–30 g) per standard load; in a DIY powder detergent, it’s typically 5–15% of the formula by weight. Dissolve well and avoid use on wool or silk.

answers.q: sodium sesquicarbonate what is it used for
answers.a: In foods (E500iii) it serves as an acidity regulator, buffer, and leavening agent. Beyond food, it’s used as a detergent builder/water softener, mild alkaline cleaner, pH buffer in baths, and in conservation treatments for bronze.
